intro: Eryngium antihystericum, commonly known as the hysteric eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiky, blue or purple flower heads. The plant has finely divided, silver-green leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Eryngium antihystericum is also known for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
